title: 2Pizza410000BTC
author: 2Pizza410000BTC
content: As a Bangladeshi I have a dream cherished inside my heart, but in reality it is not possible to realize my dream. My house is located near a popular bridge in Bangladesh and on both sides of the bridge there are parks and sightseeing spots for travelers. My father has organized a food hotel next to that sightseeing spot. I sometimes spend some time in that hotel between studies. I've been nursing a dream for as long as I've been on Bitcoin forums. If Bitcoin was legalized in Bangladesh, I would take a payment system through Bitcoin with a pizza restaurant. But my dreams will remain dreams because Bitcoin will never be legalized by the government in my country.

comments.author: crypticj
comments.body: I don't really think that Bitcoin will be legalized any time soon. Don't forget that government hates all crypto because they can't control and tax it.Especially right now, when, because of the prices, people are getting out of Bitcoin, there are not that many people who will oppose the government if it wants to ban crypto.But lets just hope most governments will just ignore crypto and let it be as it is.

comments.author: SquirrelJulietGarden
comments.body: Quote from: 2Pizza410000BTC on June 16, 2023, 02:01:22 AMI've been nursing a dream for as long as I've been on Bitcoin forums.Not sure what is your progress to grow up your dream but it's my pleasure to know.QuoteIf Bitcoin was legalized in Bangladesh, I would take a payment system through Bitcoin with a pizza restaurant.You have many options to add Bitcoin into your business, with on-chain transaction payments or with Lightning Network. With Lightning Network, you will save more transaction fee for your users and your business.QuoteBut my dreams will remain dreams because Bitcoin will never be legalized by the government in my country.Never say never. I don't know what's going on in your nation, Bangladesh from politics to economics and law, regulations. I think it is not a nation with dictactors like Putin or Kim Jong Un where one single powerful person can decide all things.There are bigger chances in your nation than in Russia or North Korea.

comments.author: franky1
comments.body: for now though. dont quash your dreams of personal wealth/freedom/employment simply because a country does not like a certain currencyinstead if you have enough bitcoin to lease a franchise/pizza restaurant for a few months(start up costs). convert bitcoin into fiat and remit it to your fiat bank. get the pizza place operational and accept fiat payments. alow your dreams to begin, dont hold backthen when you make fiat profit, remit the fiat out of the country to then convert into bitcoin again to hoard the profits to safeguard it from/hedge against fiat inflationdont delay your dreams/employment/future based on a currency. start your future and then adapt it when things change. there is no reason to not try to use fiat to bootstrap your dreams and then take profits you want to store in bitcoin

comments.author: Fundamentals Of
comments.body: Never say never! It will only take one man in the right position before your country sees the beauty in Bitcoin and accept it. Your dream will surely come true. That Bangladesh will accept Bitcoin is not a matter of if but a matter of when. It may not be within this year or the next, but it will come. Bangladesh can't afford to just allow themselves to be left behind. If you could contribute to the fulfillment of your dreams, you could easily communicate with your representative to suggest that Bitcoin be studied. They may or may not listen to it, but at least you tried.

comments.author: Die_empty

But my dreams will remain dreams because Bitcoin will never be legalized by the government in my country.Your intentions are good because accepting Bitcoin in your proposed business will attract more crypto-friendly tourists and also make more people know about Bitcoin. I also perceive that you are still a student. My advice is that you should focus on your studies for now but don't give up your dream of starting the business. You have to also note that running a business and education both needs attention and dedication which is why you need to finish your studies first before starting the business except you have competent hands that can manage it in your absence.QuoteBut my dreams will remain dreams because Bitcoin will never be legalized by the government in my country.Bitcoin is banned in your country not because the majority of the people in Bangladesh dislike it. If you carry out a poll or research the people's views on the use of Bitcoin, I guess many people will want the country to legalize cryptocurrency because of the decline of the value of the Bangladeshi taka. But the government which is made up of a few people feels cryptocurrencies are bad for the economy. Maybe the next set of political leaders might have different views about Bitcoin and legalize it. You don't have to lose hope because nothing is impossible.

I sometimes spend some time in that hotel between studies.In my view, Why this is still happening there because the Government there still sees the volatile nature of the market where Bitcoin and potential speculative bubbles raise concerns about the impact on the economy and its value is not controlled or influenced by any central authority. This lack of control may make governments hesitant to legalize it, as they may prefer to retain control over their national currencies and monetary policies.On the other hand, governments also have a responsibility to maintain financial stability in their countries because governments may prefer to focus on traditional financial systems to ensure stability and protect the interests of their citizens.Quote from: 2Pizza410000BTC on June 16, 2023, 02:01:22 AM I've been nursing a dream for as long as I've been on Bitcoin forums. If Bitcoin was legalized in Bangladesh, I would take a payment system through Bitcoin with a pizza restaurant. But my dreams will remain dreams because Bitcoin will never be legalized by the government in my country.However, I believe that perception will change over time and there will be an increased desire by governments to explore the potential of cryo-currencies taking steps towards regulatory frameworks that allow the use of legal cryptocurrencies like Bitcoin. I myself am optimistic about that because every country and government like Bangladesh has competent economists who can see and pay attention that this landscape continues to evolve over time. If that comes true your dream of using Bitcoin for your pizzeria you will come true.

comments.author: LogitechMouse
comments.body: Actually, there is a way for Bitcoin to be legalized in your country, and that is if the government will change it's stand against Bitcoin. I mean if there will be a new government that will support or at least be neutral to Bitcoin then I guess that's the time where you can use it "legally". What are the chances? Close to zero I guess... or there might be a chance. I don't know for, but one thing's for sure, Bitcoin being used in Bangladesh legally would take a long time.Sometimes, dreams will just stay as dreams because of bad government, eh? You have other choice OP, and that is to build a business outside Bangladesh, that is if only you can do it, but if the government really is that strict with regards to Bitcoin, then I guess accepting Bitcoin in your business would be close to impossible. Well, the thing that's permanent in this world is change, and who knows. We might see them changing their outlook when it comes to Bitcoin, and we might see them unbanning it in the future. I guess I'm lucky that in our country, cryptocurrencies aren't banned, and we are free to use it anytime we wanted.

comments.author: Z-tight
comments.body: You can start your dream of owning a pizza shop in your country and accept only payment in fiat for now, it is too risky to be caught using BTC as i read somewhere that it can result in almost 12 years in prison if you are caught. If you probably succeed in your pizza business, you can own a branch in another country that is BTC-friendly or in the future there may be regulatory changes in your country that will allow the use of BTC, and you can then implement it.

comments.author: michellee
comments.body: I think many people who are familiar with Bitcoin have dreams of being able to make big profits. They take care of their dreams and do something to make them come true by gradually buying Bitcoin.Maybe everyone's dream will be different but what is in common is that we want to have a lot of money from investing in Bitcoin and that is normal if there are people who don't seem to care about market conditions and just want to buy more Bitcoin to save when This.And when the Bitcoin price can increase beyond the last ATH, that is the time for them to take their biggest profits as they did at the last ATH. And there are those who don't sell all their Bitcoin but are still waiting for the price to skyrocket very high. If you want to make your dream come true, you have to work hard from now on because you still have a chance to buy more Bitcoins.

comments.author: salad daging
comments.body: I think it will be very difficult because the current government is still reluctant to legalize bitcoin as a means of payment except as a commodity asset, maybe a dream like yours, many want it because owning a restaurant business accepting bitcoin payments is something easier, but if you are in where the country is illegal with bitcoin then the dream will be difficult and will not come true.There's nothing we can do except we wait until the government legalizes it, then you should never try to fight it if you don't want it to become a problem because you can do it secretly but the law will face you if you get caught.So I'd rather be safe than face the law.

comments.author: taufik123
comments.body: It's a nice dream and you seem optimistic, but it's unfortunate that Bangladesh continues to ban Bitcoin or cryptocurrencies. This is already a regulation of your country which of course if you violate it you will get punished. I don't know how the future will be, maybe Bangladesh will accept Bitcoin but with adjusted regulations. Like in my country which makes Bitcoin regulations only as a commodity asset and cannot exceed these rules. Bitcoin cannot be used as legal tender. It's like entering a gray area that is not yet clear about the adoption that will be done.But hopefully there will be good news from the Bangladesh government about cryptocurrency rules.

comments.author: DeathAngel
comments.body: Your dream isn’t impossible. You say that you’re from Bangladesh, eventually with the fiat banking system starting to show signs of failure, nations could he forced to be kinder to bitcoin or be in real trouble. Bangladeshi currency isn’t very strong, government may be forced to buy bitcoin as a hedge. They may have to do similar to what El Salvador is doing to make things better. Your dream is not impossible.
